table.caption: Description of configuration options for rabbitmq

tr.td: (BoolOpt) A boolean to determine if the queues used for messaging should be retained after a restart.
(StrOpt) The host name of the rabbitmq server
(IntOpt) The maximum number of times to attempt to connect to the AMQP server.
(StrOpt) Exchange name to use for connection when using rabbit strategy.
(StrOpt) Topic to use for connection when using rabbit strategy.
(StrOpt) The password that will be used for authentication with the rabbitmq server.
(IntOpt) The port on which the rabbitmq server is listening
(IntOpt) This value multiplied by the number of connection attempts gives the amount of time in seconds to sleep between connection attempts to the AMQP server.

(IntOpt) The maximum amount of time to wait between connection attempts. The delay time will be the smaller of this value and the value of <rabbit_retry_backoff> * <the number of failed connection attempts so far>.
(BoolOpt) A boolean value indicating if the selected rabbitmq server uses SSL.
(StrOpt) The user ID for authentication with rabbitmq.
(StrOpt) The virtual host used in the rabbitmq connection.
